description: This Python source file provides utility functions for handling environment variable mappings between a common format and framework-specific formats, using YAML templates. It supports retrieving template paths, parsing YAML configuration files, applying prefixes, and mapping variables in both directions (common to framework-specific and vice versa).

methods.name: Path get_template_path(framework: str)
methods.description: Returns the path to the environment template file for a given framework.

methods.name: Tuple[Optional[str],Dict[str,str]] parse_template_file(template_path: Path)
methods.description: Parses a YAML template file to extract an optional prefix and a mapping dictionary.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] apply_prefix_mapping(common_env: Dict[str, str], prefix: str)
methods.description: Applies a prefix to all environment variables in a dictionary.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] map_common_to_framework(framework: str, common_env: Dict[str, str])
methods.description: Maps a set of common environment variables to framework-specific variables based on a YAML template.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] map_framework_to_common(framework: str, framework_env: Dict[str, str])
methods.description: Maps framework-specific environment variables back to a common set based on a YAML template.

methods.name: list get_supported_frameworks()
methods.description: Lists available frameworks based on presence of template directories.

ctags.pattern: /^def apply_prefix_mapping(common_env: Dict[str, str], prefix: str) -> Dict[str, str]:$/
